definition: to put sth together from component parts
to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Love is like two halves of the same shell - a perfect match.
sentences.chinese: 爱是是两个人一起拼成一颗心在线看电视剧掩护。

sentences.english: These doors are made in pieces that can be folded away against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 这些门都是几块拼成的，可以折叠起来靠在墙上。

sentences.english: Next there was the letter made of words cut from a news paper.
sentences.chinese: 接下来就由报纸上剪下来的字拼成的那封信。

sentences.english: The letters spelled a rather rude word.
sentences.chinese: 这些字母拼成了一个特别粗俗的单词。

sentences.english: The floor was made of wooden blocks.
He has also coined his own word for almond — “cork nut.”
sentences.chinese: 这只鹦鹉还能自己造词，比如把杏仁拼成软木坚果。

sentences.english: They sew the scraps together to make a pattern.
sentences.chinese: 他们把碎片缝一起拼成一种花纹。

sentences.english: Lay out all the squares and decide which pattern you want to go for.
sentences.chinese: 把所有方块摆开，决定你想要拼成什么图案。

sentences.english: Quasicrystals have regular elements, like normal crystals.
sentences.chinese: 准晶体和普通晶体一样由正几何体拼成。

sentences.english: Mother pieced together odds and ends of cloth and made a tablecloth.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈把零碎布头拼成一幅桌布。

sentences.english: I pieced out the machine with scrap parts.
sentences.chinese: 我用破铜烂铁拼成了这台机器。

sentences.english: We move them around to create new patterns or create letters.
sentences.chinese: 可以挪来挪去创造新的图案或者拼成字母。
